reviews.review_msg: This prof knows her subject well, participate in class, calls students by name to answer questions, and students were required to discuss content in pairs or groups, plus complete weekly homework. Don't miss classes. A group assignment with a presentation is worth almost half your grade. This prof shares her power points.
Shes a nice prof but shes horrible at responding to emails and her notes are very unclear because if you go back to read her notes they're very broad and incomplete...

Terrible experience. She is vague with her expectations pertaining to exams and assignments. She has spelling errors on questions which are very language sensitive. To top it off, she's passive aggressive and downright rude sometimes in her feedback to students. I've never seen a worse attitude towards students by a university professor. Appalling.

DO NOT take a class with this professor. I have never been so frustrated trying to understand course content. She is very difficult to get a hold of (e-mailed her 4 times before she responded) and responded to my questions with "maybe you will understand once the course is done" when I finally got an appointment with her.

Do not take a class with this professor. I have never felt so frustrated trying to understand course material. She is hard to get a hold of (emailed her 4 times before I got a response) and told me "maybe you will understand after the course is over" instead of answering my questions. Take the course with someone else!

She's very hard to get a hold of. Twice she just didn't respond to my emails at all. She's easy to understand in class but doesn't post info about projects, like what she expects & how she grades. Her test didn't ask one straightforward question. I studied & was still confused at what she was getting at. She seems nice until you ask her for help.

One of the best and nicest profs I've had. She is extremely helpful and concerned about her students. No trick questions and surprises in the exams. She makes the most difficult courses seem easy and gives you a great grade. I highly recommend this course for an easy grade.

She is precise in what she wants you to do, she also uses a huge, boring textbook. Takes notes all class long. She is delightful and has a great personality, she has a love for sociology which is relevant in all of her sentences.Her course would be amazing if she lightened the textbook load. But overall a great person, and a an excellent Professor!

She is one of the best professors I've had so far. very concerned about her students and helpful. she's not the kind of prof that tricks you with stupid questions in the exams. easy to get a good grade.

She mispells her own overheads and goes off on tangents every class.  It makes you wonder what standard it takes to get a Phd nowadays.  In her own words she suffers from "blonde moments".  The only upside was she was very easy on the eyes
Takes thirty minutes to go over two slides. Goes off topic all the time. go figure
